title: (x) Homecoming baseball-like script - Ballantines Script {Mike F}
content:
![](http://web.archive.org/web/20081203175145im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/homecoming_4067.jpg)
  
I can;t quite ID this thing, I know I’ll have to do the swash by hand, but if anyone can spot the main part for me, I’d be mightily grateful...:-)
 [‹ (x) Wrestling cursive script - Monotype Corsiva {Brandon S}](http://web.archive.org/web/20081203175145/http:/www.typophile.com/node/38460 "Go to previous forum topic") [In desperate need of identifying script "C" used for a baseball team ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081203175145/http:/www.typophile.com/node/38452 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Castleman

comments.content: Not the same, but check out Letterhead Fonts for Ballpark and Ephemera. You might also like Metroscript from Michael Doret.

Hi,

Its Dianna Script Bold Agency

Dianna was another name for [Ballantines Script](http://web.archive.org/web/20081203175145/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/ef/ballantines-script/#stylelist).

That linked website, by the way, is chock full of downloadable commercial fonts - including Diana Script (Castcraft/Opti).
I knew it!!! I recognized the capital A. Castleman don’t use the Diana Script Bold Agency. Its a forgery of Ballantines which is superior.
